SENT.plain: We report a 32-year-old female patient with antiphospholipid syndrome including severe coronary artery disease and multiple arterial and venous thrombosis
The patient had occlusion of the right internal thoracic artery, diffuse stenosis of the left internal thoracic artery, and occlusion of the left saphenous vein
The patient underwent successful coronary artery bypass grafting using the right gastroepiploic artery and a segment of the right saphenous vein
Antiphospholipid syndrome should be considered in young patients with myocardial infarction
